remarks: The axiom of choice implies excluded middle.  Theorem 1.3 in [Bauer] p. 483. The statement of the axiom of choice given here is ac2 in the Metamath Proof Explorer (version of 3-Aug-2019).  In particular, note that the choice function ` y ` provides a value when ` z ` is inhabited (as opposed to non-empty as in some statements of the axiom of choice). Essentially the same proof can also be found at "The axiom of choice implies instances of EM", [Crosilla], p.  "Set-theoretic principles incompatible with intuitionistic logic". Often referred to as Diaconescu's theorem, or Diaconescu-Goodman-Myhill theorem, after Radu Diaconescu who discovered it in 1975 in the framework of topos theory and N. D. Goodman and John Myhill in 1978 in the framework of set theory (although it already appeared as an exercise in Errett Bishop's book _Foundations of Constructive Analysis_ from 1967). (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 4-Aug-2019.)
